text: The Bulbul tarang (), also called Gurmukhi or Indian or Punjabi banjo, is a popular string instrument in Pakistan and the Indian subcontinent. It is primarily found in the present-day areas of Punjab and Lahore. It consists of 15 strings and is usually played similarly to a guitar. ==References== Category:Indian music Category:Pakistani music Category:Punjab Category:String instruments
title: Bulbul tarang
